intro: Ficinia trichodes, commonly known as the hairy figwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale green to purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. Ficinia trichodes is primarily ornamental but can also serve as a host plant for certain insect species.
